summary: This bill, the Kay Hagan Tick Reauthorization Act, aims to extend funding and programs related to combating vector-borne diseases. It reauthorizes sections of the Public Health Service Act concerning the National Strategy and regional centers of excellence, and support for health departments. It replaces existing funding periods (2021-2025) with new periods (2026-2030) for these programs and makes related adjustments to the governing body of the National Strategy.
